Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ventricular Performance Parameters in Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

Trial_Design.evidence: Fourteen patients with preoperative EF >35% and no contraindication to transoesophageal echocardiography (TEE) were included.

Participants.evidence: Fourteen patients with preoperative EF >35% and no contraindication to transoesophageal echocardiography (TEE) were included. The study was conducted during elective CABG.

Intervention.evidence: Eight patients received dobutamine 2.5 μg/kg/min before cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) to assess ventricular reserve.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates ventricular performance using preload adjusted peak power (PAPP), cardiac cycle efficiency (CCE), and ejection fraction (EF) in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG).

Method_Outcome.evidence: PAPP was calculated using peak systolic aortic pressure and peak aortic blood flow velocity.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fourteen patients with preoperative EF >35% and no contraindication to transoesophageal echocardiography (TEE) were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Dobutamine infusion improved PAPP values (2.4 ± 0.9 vs 3.2 ± 0.8) in all eight patients, though statistical analysis was limited by sample size.
